Articles.Content: I have flown to Duna without noticing that I had accidentally used 2x symmetry on my KER module - which I always place on the back of the command pod - which welded the pod shut. I have then edited the save game file to move the part out of the way and left it magically floating a few meters away from the command pod.

I never "got out and pushed" and only used the NERVA a grand total of once.

Also... this is difficult to say... I don't really like adding more boosters

Last night I used infinite fuel for the first time to get Bill back to Kerbin from his Mun trip.

Also, I have literally left Job out in space. He is in high orbit over Kerbin with about 1.5 units of fuel left in his jet pack.

I tried to have him fly to the passing rescue capsule. I have no idea how to match orbits and speeds.

I spend WAY too much time playing KSP

I have grown really tired of KSP twice, but I've come back both times

I use quick-save/load a lot

My Kerbal Space Station has been manned by the same crew for 17 years

I ran out of fuel landing on Moho. I then used the ALT-F12 Infini-fuel engines up to the transfer, which had way too few DV - so I cheated my way back to Kerbin (My mission planner spreadsheet still says that all three crew members are now "MOON OF MOHO", though)

When I do time-heavy missions, time consumption is 50/50 between KSP and my mission planner spreadsheet

I've never landed on Eeloo, Dres, Tylo, Laythe, Eve or Gilly. I've never really sent any missions to them either

EDIT

When I first started playing, I didn't know about RCS thrusters (at least not in the game). To translate during docking, I made a system of actiongroups and LV-1R engines. It worked well, though!=P

Edited August 21, 2014 by Kerbrud
Last night I built a probe to deliver an antenna (via KAS) I forgot to attach to my Duna mission. Fortunately, it was still in orbit around Kerbin.

I've been playing KSP for more than a year but didn't try any mods till last week.

I've never calculated a deltaV value.

I've never bothered to visit any planet that doesn't have an Easter Egg (and I've used the forums to find the Easter Eggs).

The first time I returned from orbit, I was laughing so hard at the expression on the pilot's face that I forgot to deploy the parachutes.

I swore I'd never use F5/F9/revert again. My willpower lasted slightly less than a week.
/me haz got no sins

/me haz got no sins

That's pride, a deadly sin.
I ticked on unlimited fuel in the debug menu to return from the Mun in Career mode...

The most complicated thing ive ever done unaided by mechjeb is a simple mun landing and return. Everything else was with smart ass and the man node planner. (though, to be fair, I'm pretty sure real life spaceship pilots have some kind of smart ass like system and sciencey people that plan burns ahead of time).

But i get the impression that mechjeb is sinfull the way it is often portrayed on the forums fortunately, im not losing any sleep over it

When I started my latest sandbox game, I used Kethane's debug mode to reveal all deposits rather than building and flying a scanning satellite for the dozenth time. Also, I regenerated the deposits until there was at least one on the Minmus flats near the equator.

Edited August 21, 2014 by Tinyboss

I have spent as much time bugfixing my ridiculously modded .24 build as I have spent playing it >.>

. . . but I can't stop. Unmodded will not be tolerated!!!!

Also, I seem to have gotten it stable, so maybe my sins have paid off?

alright fine, my ssto rocket didnt have a parachute and used a ton of spaceplane+ radial air intakes and firespitter intake air canisters. but I didnt need to use the LFO part until I got into orbit, so thats good right? right? *sigh* every ones a critic.....

I use MechJeb for everything except planes (space and regular) and rovers.

I always turn off Lost Crews Respawn... and promptly have Jeb die when he sneaks onboard a doomed vessel. (I never revert unless building test craft.)

I just put an RTG inside a cockpit on a small spaceplane to make the centers of mass stay the same and not spoil its smooth lines. Sure, the kerbals are only in it for a couple of hours, but the thing is totally unshielded.
Tell them it's the cockpit heater
I did not completely unlock a career-mode science tree in 0.24.x before 0.25 was released.

I'm not updating to 0.25, I can't get excited about any of the new features...

I can't do much on the first try, I usually need to quick-save a lot. ( I have over 250 quick-saves in my current save)

I have never completed a tech tree, stock or modded.

One of my Duna return missions was so bad, rather than restarting it from scratch, I just quick-loaded over and over and over again until I succeeded.
I can do lots of stuff... at about 30% efficiency

Whenever a ship doesn't work like it should, I HyperEdit it so it does. Mostly because I cannot stand losing. This is a habit I really have to cut back on...

Also, I have literally left Job out in space. He is in high orbit over Kerbin with about 1.5 units of fuel left in his jet pack.

It's not a good idea to leave Job in outer space... there are several jobless people around the world needing extra money!
To be sure my design is safe for probes, I use kerbals to test rockets.
After more than a week and all buildings are still intact. Some reason I feel that I did something wrong.

Built a mean looking plane & completed a bunch of fineprint 'survey' contracts before discovering an aerodynamic stability issue that meant I couldn't land it. Ah, Jeb, I have good news and bad news...

Must...test...more...thoroughly.

After more than a week and all buildings are still intact. Some reason I feel that I did something wrong.

I must confess that I have not destroyed a building yet, either. We need to start a support group or something.
I have never had a successful "land on Eve and return to Kerbin" trip.
